channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Signs and cones left behind, 2nd January
item.description:
Cones and signs left behind. Some on path at end of finchcroft lane and some at path entrance to honeysuckle close. Left behind from work on footpath running from prestbury school to finchcroft lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Finchcroft Lane, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.description:

item.title: Cattle ruining path, 1st January
item.description:
Around the meadows there is a footpath. Where this bottlenecks between theeadows each path becomes boggy and impassable due to the cattle trampling the ground. This is whilst it's been dry and as soons as it rains these will turn intoassive puddles making the issue worse like last year. Some further soil, stones or some sort of crossing is needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Marten Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe double rim--more likely to hit hand/head, 1st January
item.description:
Having experienced this first hand, a second rim lower than the standard rim (10ft) increases the risk of injury. If you were to jump high enough, it is unnatural for a second rim to be there while playing basketball. Instead, there should be a single rim (potentially with net) for safer use of the court. Issue has been present since the court opened.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The potholes that were supposed to be fixed are in fact not fixed at all. One pothole has been filled in. There are multiple more potholes that need filling as a matter of urgency, 1st January
item.description:
The potholes start from the junction of Blaisdon Way, all the way to the junction of Pilgrove Way. The road goes past Hayden Road Allotments. The potholes have been there for around a few month and have been getting worse. Multiple cars are having to swerve all over the road to avoid damaging their tyres. Some cars are even driving on the other side of the road to avoid them all. They all need filling in or even better, the road needs resurfacing altogether.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes on this road, 1st January
item.description:
There is multiple pot holes on this road as there is so many they are unavoidable this issue is worse from elm close to lime close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Linden Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
